concise_definition: v. 俯冲, 突袭, 抓取; n. 俯冲, 突袭

definitions.explanation_en: To move quickly and suddenly downward, especially in a curved path, as a bird of prey does when attacking its target.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指像猛禽一样迅速而突然地向下俯冲，通常呈弧线轨迹，用于攻击目标。
definitions.example_en: The hawk swooped down and snatched the mouse from the grass.
definitions.example_cn: 鹰俯冲而下，从草丛中抓走了那只老鼠。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a sudden, swift attack or move to seize something, often unexpectedly or in large numbers.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指突然、迅速地发动袭击或行动，以夺取某物，常带有出其不意或群体行动的意味。
definitions.example_en: Shoppers swooped on the discounted items as soon as the store opened.
definitions.example_cn: 商店一开门，顾客们便蜂拥而上抢购打折商品。

definitions.explanation_en: A sudden, swift downward movement or attack, especially by a bird or a group of people.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指突然而迅速的向下移动或袭击，尤指鸟类或人群的行动。
definitions.example_en: The swoop of the falcon was so fast that the rabbit had no time to escape.
definitions.example_cn: 游隼的俯冲如此迅捷，兔子根本来不及逃跑。

definitions.explanation_en: A sudden, large-scale effort to collect or capture something, often in a surprise operation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一次突然的大规模行动，旨在收集或捕获某物，常带有突袭性质。
definitions.example_en: Police carried out a swoop on the illegal gambling den and arrested ten people.
definitions.example_cn: 警方对非法赌场展开突袭，逮捕了十人。

comparison.analysis: “Dive” (俯冲/跳水) 通常指垂直或倾斜地向下运动，可以是主动的（如跳水）或被动的（如飞机俯冲），但不一定带有攻击性或突然性。而 “swoop” 强调弧线轨迹、速度和攻击意图，常用于捕食或突袭场景。
“Ambush” (伏击) 是一种有预谋的隐蔽攻击，强调隐藏和等待时机，而 “swoop” 更强调突然性和速度，常为无预兆的快速行动，不一定需要隐藏。例如，警察的突袭是 swoop，而埋伏在路边的袭击是 ambush。
“Snatch” (抢夺) 侧重于快速抓取或夺取某物的动作本身，常用于手部动作或小范围争夺。而 “swoop” 不仅包含抓取，还包含一个完整的、动态的运动轨迹（如俯冲），常用于描述更大范围或更壮观的行动，如鸟类或人群的集体行动。
